TopicTitle: What do you think the Mystery goo really is ?

Articles.Content: I dunno, I saw it pop up and thought of a funny (I thought it was funny) reply.
I think its an experiment that flat earthers on Kerbin that would point Kerbals to the idea that they are instead living on a disk... CDrom, DVDrom, BlueRay...

The goo is a doughy substance made of flour, egg, vanilla essence, sugar, baking powder, butter, white phosphorus, and a bit of plutonium (to make it glow), mixed into a batter and left to cool. A nugget of purest green may be added as seasoning. The mystery is quite why it appears to have become sentient.

The Mystery Goo is made of Mister E. Kerman - But someone mislabeled his burial urn "Mystery" - his life-long wish was to visit every celestial body in the Kerbol system. Sadly, he passed away long before his wish could be fulfilled and so Kerbals now bring his remains along to honor him, and there's even science to be had from doing it.

Kerbal turd in a test tube me thinks.

It would answer the difference between low and high orbit readings. There's less electro magnetic radiation higher around a planet.
There's a lot of testing being done on bacterial growth and behaviour through exposure by electro magnetic radiation at different levels.
I believe a turd is consistent of much of those pesky things. This makes turd a viable sample for biological testing based on differentiating electro magnetic exposure between high and lower orbits. It would also supply a onboard container for Kerbals turd to be collected since I can't find any hatches that releases it. This means it's stored onboard.
Karken roe. It is basically  egg masses that can only mature and hatch under very special conditions, like a warm oxygen and water rich environment.

When the goo is observed near the shore, it coalesces near the sea-facing side of the container, it likes water.

the goo feels at home on the mun and minmus, minmus used to have liquid oceans... 

the goo is an ancient creature that used to live in minmus' oceans, or maybe... it was the oceans...

40 minutes ago, Lukesmith0123 said:

When the goo is observed near the shore, it coalesces near the sea-facing side of the container, it likes water.

the goo feels at home on the mun and minmus, minmus used to have liquid oceans... 

the goo is an ancient creature that used to live in minmus' oceans, or maybe... it was the oceans...

It's a Kraken baby!
Holy necro... but iv always been facinated by a good lore speculation. Good times

it's probably an environment-sensitive bacterial goop some kerbal once caught while swimming in the Arktik Ocean, which would explain its preference for water, cold, and salt

Edited October 3, 2021 by OrdinaryKerman

Kerbals in their raw goop form? Dead kerbals? kerbals perserved in a type of stasis? Maybe kerbals are slimes taking humanoid forms.

When kerbals go off the screen and stop being useful they go back into their slime pods until needed. That is why we can't see past the walls! Inside the walls are massive amount of those pods just like the matrix! That is what the mystery goo containers is.

Edited November 1, 2021 by Arugela
Melted ice cream they send into space so that it un-melts.
The answer is obvious, how come nobody on the front page got it(did not check pages in between ..). It is dormant protomolecule from The Expanse.

I've always imagined Mystery Goo is like the visceroids from C&C Tiberian Sun. A featureless blob of Kerbal biomass that just rolls around mindlessly. Its relationship to Kerbalkind might be like that shared between squigs and orks in Warhammer; possibly Goo is grown for food, some instances are kept as pets, and so on.

Nondiegetically, I've read a claim that the Goo is simply intended to be a friendly representation of the animals humans sent to space.

Edited November 10, 2021 by Rocket Witch
Jelly from some poor KSC interns sandwich

I have 3 theories on this:

  1.  The goo is from outer space, possibly from magic boulders or regular asteroids, evidenced from the scientific result, "The goo feels right at home here.", which is taken in space.
  2. The goo is a bi-product of the strange substance the R/D department uses for fuel, evidenced by the mysterious green substance found on the launch pad.
  3. The goo is of Joolean nature, evidenced from the scientific result, "The goo feels right at home here.", which is taken while descending into Jool's atmosphere.

Theories 1 and 2 are equally likely, but theory 3 is less likely.
